alert.note: Alert for Hunt; Kaufman; Rockwall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 07 at 6:59PM CST until February 09 at 9:16PM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Cowleech Fork Sabine River At Greenville affecting Hunt County. South Fork Sabine River Near Quinlan affecting Kaufman, Rockwall and Hunt Counties. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Sabine River Near Quinlan. * WHEN...From late tonight to late Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Moderate out of bank flooding will occur. Some farm and cattle industries will be flooded. Some rural roads will be underwater. Water will be over the road and the FM 1565 bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 5.9 feet. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 16.9 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
